p:
Oviposition Activity Index (OAI) was calculated using the formula.
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$ \mathrm{OAI}=\left(\mathrm{NT}-\mathrm{NC}\right)/\left(\mathrm{NT}+\mathrm{NC}\right) $$\end{document}
OAI =
NT − NC
/
NT + NC
where NT is the total number of eggs on the treated substrate and NC the total number of eggs on the control substrate (Cheah et al. 2013). For OAI values ≤ −0.3, the EO was considered as repellent (Kramer and Mulla 1979).
